titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Margaret Trumbull Corwin (1889-1983) was a 1912 graduate of Bryn Mawr College. She received a master's degree in modern languages from Yale University. In 1919, she went to France with the YMCA and was stationed with the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune. She worked as an executive secretary at the Yale University Graduate School for 16 years before joining Rutgers University's New Jersey College for Women (now known as Douglass College) where she was a dean from 1934 to 1955.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of correspondence and photographs of Margaret Trumbull Corwin. These materials are largely related to Corwin's travels to Japan, China, India, Palestine, Iceland, Russia, Sweden, and Mexico. The collection also includes a small number of records of her career at Rutgers, including newspaper clippings and a book created by her colleagues to commemorate her retirement.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
